dt.t: She and her {wi}coresearchers{/wi} presented their findings.
… was sharply challenged by numerous {wi}co-researchers{/wi}, who claimed the study's results were tentative, ambiguous and negligible …

shortdef: one that engages in research with another

dt: {bc}research into the size, location, and makeup of a product market

shortdef: research into the size, location, and makeup of a product market

dt: {bc}damaging information about a political candidate that is gathered and used or made public usually by an opponent's camp

dt.t: {ldquo}I mean, everybody has {wi}oppo{/wi} on their opponents, but nobody admits it.{rdquo}

The GOP sure has the goods on Erica McAdoo. On Thursday, NC House Republicans released a 35-page report—known as {ldquo}{wi}oppo{/wi}{rdquo} to political insiders and observers—on the NC House 63 candidate from Alamance County.

… the crucial revelation here is that when you make a political consultant your senior policy adviser, spin supplants substance, {phrase}oppo research{/phrase} rules and winning the news cycle becomes more important than winning the war.
Dirty politics has been around since Thomas Jefferson's {phrase}oppo researchers{/phrase} went after Alexander Hamilton's mistress in 1800, but there's more money in it these days.
{ldquo}… put out a series of talking points that looked like an {phrase}oppo dump{/phrase} that you'd put out on a political opponent …{ldquo}

et: shortened from {it}opposition research,{/it} with assimilation to {et_link|-o:1|-o:1}
shortdef: damaging information about a political candidate that is gathered and used or made public usually by an opponent's camp
